title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: MIC Electronics wins first railway order for RMPU controller
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- MIC Electronics wins its first Indian Railways order for a Microprocessor Controller for Roof Mounted AC Package Units (RMPU), approved by *RDSO*. 
- The order from *Northeast Frontier Railway (NFR)* targets *LHB passenger coaches*, marking MIC's expansion into railway automation. 
- Deliveries will be completed within 45 days with after-sales support, aiding wider adoption as Indian Railways transitions to *LHB* and double-decker AC coaches.

items.title: How Odisha govt is steering a ₹5 lakh crore industrial investment push by 2029
Microsoft in talks with Broadcom for custom AI chips
items.summary: - Microsoft is in talks with *Broadcom* to design *custom AI chips* for future infrastructure, potentially moving from *Marvell* and aligning with *OpenAI*. - The discussions follow *OpenAI*'s deal with *Broadcom*, signaling a push to secure purpose-built silicon and reduce reliance on *Nvidia*. - The move signals intensifying competition to secure *AI compute infrastructure* as demand grows.

items.title: Record-low battery storage bids in India can undermine project viability: Experts
Adani invests ₹10k crore in Telangana, 7k+ jobs created
items.summary:
- The Adani Group has invested nearly *₹10,000 crore* in Telangana over three years, **creating 7,000+ jobs**.
- Investments span *Defense manufacturing*, *Green Data Centers*, Renewable energy, and Cement facilities, including a **48 MW data center**.
- A *defense and aerospace park* with a **UAV facility in Hyderabad**, plus ₹4,000 crore in roads delivering 100+ km of highways, underpins long‑term growth.

items.title: Apollo Micro Systems lines up ₹1,500 crore greenfield expansion for defence manufacturing in Telangana
Minda gets Yamuna Expressway land for ₹500 crore manufacturing unit
Telangana’s loss is Andhra’s gain as pharma companies expand in Kurnool
Vingroup to invest $3 billion in Telangana across urban development, EVs and energy
Innomotics India to acquire Siemens LV and geared motors
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Innomotics India will acquire Siemens Limited's *Low Voltage (LV) Motors* and *Geared Motors* business in *India*. 
- The deal adds an *end-to-end portfolio* including LV, Geared, high‑voltage motors and large drives, aligning with *Innomotics*' global operations. 
- The move enables more customised solutions and strengthens the *brand presence* of *Innomotics India* across the Indian market.

items.title: More companies plan hiring in March quarter but overall hiring volumes to come down
Tata eyes IAF's Medium Transport Aircraft contract, to set up MRO
items.author: Manu Pubby, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- **Tata** aims to clinch the *Medium Transport Aircraft* contract and set up Bengaluru *MRO* for C-130J.
- TASL already partners with **Lockheed Martin** for C-130 empennages and aims for the first C-130J by early 2027.
- The race includes Airbus, Lockheed Martin and Embraer, with ~80 aircraft to replace the ageing AN-32 fleet.

items.title: Trump approves Nvidia AI chips sales to China
items.summary:
- **Nvidia**'s H200 AI chips could be sold to *approved customers* in China, aiming to support *American jobs* and U.S. manufacturing.
- Critics in the Senate warned such exports could bolster China's military tech and cyber capabilities.
- Nvidia welcomed the move, saying the Commerce Department would vet buyers to balance *economic interests* with *national security* concerns.

items.title: Mark Titus Appointed President, Nippon Paint India
items.summary:
- **Mark Titus** has been appointed President – Decorative Business at Nippon Paint India, effective *1 December 2025*, reporting to **Sharad Malhotra**.
- He will lead the *decorative coatings* business across India, driving strategy across product, channel, digital and brand platforms with a focus on innovation and growth.
- With over two decades in FMCG and paints, Titus will strengthen Nippon Paint India's presence through partnerships, digital engagement and sustainable expansion.

items.title: Intel-Tata pact to make semiconductors in India
items.summary:
- Intel and **Tata** ink a pact to manufacture and assemble *semiconductors* in **India** for the local market and to scale AI PC solutions.
- The plan centers on facilities in Dholera, Gujarat and Assam, with a total investment of ₹1.18 lakh crore, and advanced packaging/EMS collaboration.
- The deal strengthens India’s supply chain, OSAT/EMS capabilities, and global AI compute leadership by 2030.

items.title: Parity in corrosion protection: domestic vs export cars
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- *Export-bound* vehicles use galvanised steel and longer *corrosion warranties*; Indian *domestic cars* often have minimal galvanisation.
- Rust-related damage raises safety risks and long-term costs, lowering resale value.
- Updating *CMVR* and *BIS* standards could ensure parity, boosting longevity and consumer value.

items.title: Telangana Rising Global Summit secures ₹1.88 lakh cr investments on Day 1
items.author: PTI
items.summary: - Telangana Rising Global Summit Day 1 saw investment proposals totalling *₹1.88 lakh crore* across *Deep Tech*, *Core Infrastructure*, and *Future City*.\n- Major deals include *Brookfield / Axis Ventures* ₹75,000 crore, *Evren / Axis Energy* ₹31,500 crore for renewables, *Vin Group* ₹27,000 crore, *GMR Group* ₹15,000 crore, *MEIL* ₹8,000 crore, and Defence MOUs ₹5,000 crore.\n- Chief Minister *A Revanth Reddy* called Day 1 a mandate for *Vision 2047* and pledged to translate investments into jobs, infrastructure and Telangana's rise in India's economy.

items.title: Parliament clears cess on pan masala units
items.summary:
- Parliament approved the **National Security Cess Bill 2025** to levy a **cess** on pan masala manufacturing units to fund **national security** and **public health**.
- The **cess** will be over and above **GST** and based on production capacity of machines in pan masala factories.
- Finance Minister *Nirmala Sitharaman* said the levy will serve the cost of national and health security.

items.title: LG Energy Solution seals $1.4B EV battery deal with MB
items.summary:
- LG Energy Solution signed a deal worth about *2 trillion won* ($1.4B) with **Mercedes-Benz** to supply EV batteries.
- The agreement runs from March 1, 2028, to June 30, 2035, covering deliveries to **North America** and **Europe**.
- Analysts view it as a step toward more affordable models and broader global expansion, with the deal accounting for roughly *8%* of LG Energy Solution's revenue last year.

items.title: JSW Infra to buy 3 rail logistics firms for ₹1,212 cr
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary: - The deal values the acquisition at *₹1,212 crore* and covers three JSW rail logistics units: *Rail Infra Logistics*, *Minerals Rail Logistics*, and *South Rail Logistics*.\n- Post‑closing, the firms become step‑down subsidiaries of *JSW Infrastructure* and give access to *GPWIS* and *LSFTO* schemes for rail freight.\n- JSW Infrastructure aims to expand its *multimodal logistics platform*, scaling its *rake fleet* from 25 to 45 by *FY27* and 110 by *FY30*.

items.title: SFO Tech mulling ₹2,270 crore electronic components plant in Tamil Nadu
High-value parts push up electronics firms' import bill
Tata-Intel tie-up for $14B India chip plan
items.summary:
- Tata Electronics will invest about *$14B* to build India's first semiconductor fabrication plant in Gujarat and a chip assembly/testing facility in Assam, with **Intel** as the first major customer.
- The partnership will explore rapidly scaling **AI PC** solutions for consumer and enterprise markets in India, signaling confidence in domestic manufacturing.
- The move aligns with PM Modi's drive to make India a global chipmaker and target a top-five chip market status by 2030.

items.title: Realme plans to manufacture AIoT products in India by 2027
items.author: Mansi Taneja, ETTelecom
items.summary:
- Realme plans to manufacture its entire *AIoT* range in **India** by 2027, including smartwatches, earbuds and accessories, via Optiemus Electronics Limited.
- The move aims to position India as a regional **export hub** for AIoT devices to Russia, South Asia, the Middle East and the EU, creating over 2,000 direct jobs and boosting R&D.
- Realme has already launched the Realme Watch 5, manufactured in India through Optiemus, priced at ₹4,499 (intro ₹3,999) with sales starting Dec 10, 2025.

items.title: Maharashtra breaks record: 45,911 solar pumps
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - **Guinness World Record** as 45,911 off-grid solar pumps were installed in 30 days, making Maharashtra the *fastest-deploying solar agriculture state* and *second globally after China*.\n- The rollout under PM-KUSUM Component B and Magel Tyala Saur Krushi Pump Yojana used landholding-based allocation, strict SLAs, and GK Energy contributed ~17% of pumps.\n- It aims to boost irrigation security, raise farm productivity, and ease grid load, signaling a major step in India's clean-energy transition.

items.title: Adani Green adopts TNFD for nature-positive renewables
items.summary:
- **TNFD** guidance integrated into AGEL's sustainability strategy, signaling a shift toward nature-positive renewable energy development.
- The TNFD framework provides a structured approach to identify, assess, manage and disclose nature-related risks and opportunities, strengthening AGEL's biodiversity focus.
- AGEL commits to *No Net Loss of Biodiversity by 2030*, with FY24 assessments and plans to plant 27.86 million trees and reach 50 GW by 2030.

items.title: LG Energy Solution signs $1.4B EV battery deal with Mercedes-Benz
items.summary:
- **LG Energy Solution** and **Mercedes-Benz** signed a deal worth around 2 trillion won ($1.4B) to supply EV batteries.
- The contract runs March 1, 2028 to June 30, 2035, covering deliveries to *North America* and *Europe*, with value and duration subject to change.
- It represents about 8% of LG Energy Solution's revenue and supports **Mercedes-Benz**'s push to broaden its EV lineup toward mid- to entry-tier models.

items.title: Navitas ties up with Cyient Semiconductors to boost GaN adoption in India
Reliance Infra setting up integrated solar manufacturing ecosystem
items.author: PTI
items.summary: - Reliance Infrastructure is building a high-value, vertically integrated solar ecosystem spanning ingots, wafers, cells and modules to reduce *import dependence* and strengthen India’s clean energy *security*.\n- The facility aims to bridge the 55-60 GW annual module demand by 2030, using next-gen technology as upstream capacity remains tight.\n- It will establish an end-to-end **battery manufacturing ecosystem** covering cell production, pack assembly and grid-scale BESS, with India's stationary storage base rising to 250 GWh by 2032.

items.title: Kaynes Tech falls as lapses flagged; company denies errors
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Kaynes Technology's shares slid ~**6.7%** after brokerages flagged lapses in disclosures and a Kotak **Equities** report raised concerns (five‑day drop ~**22.8%**).
- The company says there was only one accounting error and that other notes on related‑party transactions were a *small typographical omission*, with **no ambiguities** in the books.
- FY25 revenue rose to ₹2,720 crore (+51% YoY) aided by *Iskraemeco*'s smart metering consolidation and acquisitions, with **Ind‑AS 103** treatment and corresponding goodwill/asset adjustments.

items.title: HFCL secures mega ₹657 crore deal to export optic fibre cable
Tamil Nadu targets global market with new Toy Manufacturing Policy 2025
Indian startups entering global markets to shield operational tech from cyberthreats
Call of duty infuses fresh energy into local gear makers
India emerges as key driver of global renewable energy surge: Joshi
Ritu Raj Sinha passes away; Tata Steel UISL MD
items.author: B Sridhar
items.summary:
- *Ritu Raj Sinha*, 58, MD of Tata Steel UISL and former Tata Steel corporate administrator, passed away after suffering a nose bleed following lunch.
- The city mourned **TS UISL**'s work, which boosted public amenities and helped **Jamshedpur** rank 3rd in **Swachh Survekshan 2024-25**.
- Last rites will be held at Parvati Ghat crematorium on November 9; tributes came from former Odisha governor **Raghubar Das** and other leaders.

items.title: India says no advisory to stop clean energy funding
items.summary:
- *India's clean energy ministry said it has not issued any advisory to pause or halt new financing for the solar sector.*
- *The clarification followed Reuters' report that lenders were advised to adopt a calibrated approach due to oversupply, not to stop funding.*
- *Analysts warned that broad caution could hurt solar cell manufacturing and delay projects, increasing reliance on imports.*

items.title: Defence production hits ₹1.51 lakh cr; exports near ₹24k cr
items.summary:
- *Rajnath Singh* said India is shifting from import-dependence to a producer-exporter as defence production rose to ₹1.51 lakh crore and exports near ₹24,000 crore.
- BRO (Border Roads Organisation) completed 28 roads and 93 bridges across Ladakh, J&K and seven states at ₹5,000 crore.
- The push under *Aatmanirbhar Bharat* and indigenous tech shows engineering self-reliance, including Class-70 modular bridges designed and manufactured in India.

items.title: Smart-meter interoperability; 307 GW coal by 2035
items.summary:
- *Interoperability* across smart meters to avoid vendor lock-in, with different manufacturers on common protocols; rollout targeted for **April 2026** or **January 2027**.
- India aims to keep **307 GW** coal capacity by 2035, with transmission upgrades like Khetri-Narela (>4.5 GW) and Badla-Seekar to ease bottlenecks.
- RDSS has sanctioned **20.33 crore** smart meters in 28 states/UTs, of which **2.41 crore** installed; Gujarat sanctioned **1.67 crore**, with **20.94 lakh** installed; scheme reduces AT&C losses and improves reliability.

items.title: Copper industry seeks curb on cheap imports
items.author: Nikita Periwal, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Indian copper producers, led by the *IPCPA*, urge the government to curb cheap imports from FTAs, including *ASEAN* and *Japan*. 
- They seek an **additional 3%** duty on copper cathodes, rods, wires and tubes, plus quantitative import curbs, citing about *₹20,000 crore* invested in the last five years. 
- The report highlights tariff rules under CEPA with the UAE (wire-rods duties falling to zero by FY27 and a call for a ~1/3 cut in the tariff quota) and notes Indonesia’s continued refined copper shipments under ASEAN despite concentrate bans.

items.title: Not issued any advisory to stop finance to renewables: MNRE
items.summary:
- The **MNRE** clarified it has not issued any advisory to *financial institutions* to stop lending to renewable energy projects or to renewable energy equipment manufacturing facilities.
- It said it has circulated the status of domestic *solar PV manufacturing* to lenders to enable a calibrated financing approach, not to halt funding.
- The ministry will continue engaging with stakeholders to keep India's solar journey *inclusive*, *competitive*, and *future-ready*, supported by the PLI scheme and ALMM.

items.title: EAM talks deeper cooperation at India-Japan Forum
items.summary: - **EAM S Jaishankar** participated in the India-Japan Forum opening session in New Delhi, discussing the evolving world order and deeper *India-Japan cooperation*.\n- The forum aims to bolster cooperation, build mutual trust, and develop a joint agenda for future cooperation, with 70–80 high-level participants under Chatham House rules.\n- Earlier remarks in 2024 highlighted strengthening ties in *semiconductor collaboration*, defence and resilient supply chains, underscoring the growing strategic partnership.

items.title: Coking coal imports rise in Oct on winter restocking
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Coking coal imports rose 12% to *5.04 MT*, aided by *winter restocking* by steel mills, while **overall coal imports** fell 3.9% to 20.97 MT.
- The decline in imports reflects a domestic surplus; steel manufacturers usually boost purchases before colder months to secure supplies.
- Initiatives like the **Coking Coal Mission** and the *WDO route* aim to raise domestic coking coal use and curb imports, with Q4 imports likely subdued as domestic production rises.

items.title: Manomay expands capacity, adopts cleaner production
items.summary:
- Rajasthan-based Manomay Tex India Ltd is expanding capacity with 864 spindles and pursuing *cleaner production* for sustainable growth.
- It is strengthening its domestic and international footprint, exporting to 16+ countries including Colombia, Mexico, Egypt, Chile, and Venezuela.
- In H1 FY26, revenue reached ₹330 crore and PAT ₹10 crore, aided by measures like zero liquid discharge, water recycling, and renewable energy.

items.title: The solar surge and the supply chain gap: India’s energy triumph and industrial paradox
SFO Tech mulling ₹2,270 crore electronic components plant in Tamil Nadu
Piyush Goyal holds key meetings to strengthen ties in semiconductors, carbon capture and medtech
Mobile phone imports drop to 0.02% of demand in 2024-25
items.author: Press Trust of India
items.summary: - Mobile phone imports have fallen to *0.02%* of domestic demand in 2024-25, down from *75%* in *2014-15*.\n- Mobile phone exports surged to ₹2 lakh crore in 2024-25, up *127x* from ₹0.01 lakh crore in *2014-15*.\n- The government’s measures, including *PLI schemes* and *Atma Nirbhar Bharat*, aim to boost domestic electronics manufacturing.

items.title: Cabinet push to healthcare manufacturing, life science hub
items.summary: - The Bhubaneswar cabinet approved the Odisha Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Policy-2025 to position Odisha as a hub for *healthcare manufacturing* and *life science sectors*.\n- It envisages the Odisha Pharma Park and Odisha Medtech Park to provide industrial infrastructure, with the **Odisha Pharmaceutical Development Cell** as the lead agency.\n- The policy maps a strategic route and cluster formation to realize a prosperous Odisha by 2036 and a developed India by 2047.
